intro: Gaillonia olivieri, commonly known as the olive tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Oleaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It is well adapted to dry and rocky soils, making it a resilient species in arid environments. Gaillonia olivieri has been cultivated for thousands of years for its oil and as a source of food.
